message.content:
cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with distributed computing and communication among identical nodes, which falls under the category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC). The focus on simplicity and robustness suggests a possible sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). The measurement of quality in terms of interactions and states per node suggests a possible sub-category of Information Theory (cs.IT). The global task of determining the majority opinion suggests a possible sub-category of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the use of protocols and optimization suggests a possible sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG).
